panels.description: Monitors hardware sensor temperatures and critical thresholds as exposed by Linux hwmon. Includes CPU, GPU, and motherboard sensors where available
panels.title: Hardware Temperature Monitor

panels.description: Overall CPU busy percentage (averaged across all cores)
panels.title: CPU Busy

panels.description: Real RAM usage excluding cache and reclaimable memory
panels.title: RAM Used

panels.description: CPU time spent busy vs idle, split by activity type
panels.title: CPU Basic

panels.description: RAM and swap usage overview, including caches
panels.title: Memory Basic

panels.description: Percentage of filesystem space used for each mounted device

targets.expr: ((node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"} - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) / node_filesystem_size_bytes{instance="$node", job="$job", device!~"rootfs"}) * 100

panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

panels.description: Number of bytes read from or written to the device per second
panels.title: Disk Read/Write Data

panels.description: Per-interface network traffic (receive and transmit) in bits per second
panels.title: Network Traffic Basic

panels.description: Real-time CPU frequency scaling per core, including average minimum and maximum allowed scaling frequencies
panels.title: CPU Frequency Scaling

panels.description: System load average over 1, 5, and 15 minutes. Reflects the number of active or waiting processes. Values above CPU core count may indicate overload
panels.title: System Load

panels.description: Rate of scheduling timeslices executed per CPU. Reflects how frequently the scheduler switches tasks on each core
panels.title: CPU Schedule Timeslices

panels.description: Number of network packets received and transmitted per second, by interface.
panels.title: Network Traffic by Packets

panels.description: Maximum speed of each network interface as reported by the operating system. This is a static hardware capability, not current throughput
panels.title: Speed

panels.description: MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) in bytes for each network interface. Affects packet size and transmission efficiency
panels.title: MTU

panels.description: Packets processed and dropped by the softnet network stack per CPU. Drops may indicate CPU saturation or network driver limitations
panels.title: Softnet Packets

panels.description: Rate of octets sent and received at the IP layer, as reported by /proc/net/netstat
panels.title: Netstat IP In / Out Octets

panels.description: Rate of UDP datagrams sent and received per second, based on /proc/net/netstat
panels.title: UDP In / Out

panels.description: Duration of each individual collector executed during a Node Exporter scrape. Useful for identifying slow or failing collectors
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape Time

panels.description: Shows whether each Node Exporter collector scraped successfully (1 = success, 0 = failure), and whether the textfile collector returned an error.
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape
